abstract: Homeowners could face pressure from lenders’ reluctance to allow sales for less than what remains on the mortgage.
snippet: Homeowners could face pressure from lenders’ reluctance to allow sales for less than what remains on the mortgage.
lead_paragraph: PHOENIX — Bank of America and GMAC are firing up their formidable foreclosure machines again today, after a brief pause.

headline.main: Short Sales Resisted as Foreclosures Are Revived
headline.print_headline: Owners Seek to Sell at a Loss, But Bankers Push Foreclosure

abstract: As Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings, the bank said that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it had reviewed.
snippet: As Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings, the bank said that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it had reviewed.
lead_paragraph: Even as Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings in 23 states on Monday, the bank confirmed that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it has reviewed.

abstract: As Bank of America and GMAC resume foreclosures, homeowners could face pressure from lenders’ reluctance to allow homes to sell for less than what remains on the mortgage.
snippet: As Bank of America and GMAC resume foreclosures, homeowners could face pressure from lenders’ reluctance to allow homes to sell for less than what remains on the mortgage.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America and GMAC are firing up their formidable foreclosure machines again today, after a brief pause, Michael Powell reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Owners Seek to Sell, but Banks Push Foreclosure

abstract: As Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings, the bank said that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it had reviewed.
snippet: As Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings, the bank said that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it had reviewed.
lead_paragraph: Even as Bank of America begins to restart foreclosure proceedings in 23 states on Monday, the bank confirmed that it had discovered errors, including incorrect data and misspelled names, in the paperwork it had reviewed, Nelson D. Schwartz reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: Foreclosures Had Errors, Bank of America Finds

abstract: Bank of America shouldn’t count on putting its foreclosure problems behind it so quickly, Joe Nocera writes in his latest column.
snippet: Bank of America shouldn’t count on putting its foreclosure problems behind it so quickly, Joe Nocera writes in his latest column.

headline.main: Nocera: Big Problem for Banks — Due Process

abstract: A Dubai court restarted a fraud trial against two former executives of Dubai Islamic Bank Sunday having changed their status to government officials, making a stricter punishment more likely, Reuters reported.
snippet: A Dubai court restarted a fraud trial against two former executives of Dubai Islamic Bank Sunday having changed their status to government officials, making a stricter punishment more likely, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: A Dubai court has restarted a fraud trial against two former executives of Dubai Islamic Bank. The court changed their status to government officials on Sunday, making a stricter punishment more likely, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Ex-Executives of Dubai Bank Face Heavier Penalties
